title: @RiotRepertoir Status check on the Yorick gameplay update?
body:
Let's try this again: Just wondering if there's any sort of update or ETA on the Yorick remake/update/whatnot. Given that, AFAIK, he's one of the oldest kits around and one deemed so utterly cancerous and "unfun" that he had the dubious honor of being outright removed from the free rotation (again, AFAIK), it would seem like a high priority champ to rework or update.

We've heard that the current plans seem to prioritizing Poppy, Taric and even Quinn, but nothing about Yorick (whose update we last heard about since before Ao Shin IIRC?)... so, just wondering if there's any update on him or if he's been iceboxed.

Cheers.

replies.body:
He's not been iceboxed, solcrushed is doing some early design work and he will go full steam on yorick once he finishes up with poppy. No dates are clear at all yet, but I can say that he wont ship before poppy or taric as we need that whole art/sound/engineering team to work on him when they finish those projects. 

High level we are gonna have to rebuild this guy from the ground up. The starting point of core elements to keep that we have in mind right now are "ghoul summoner" and "Imposing melee fighter."

Are there any things we're missing on what makes Yoirck Yorick?
I feel he should remain a lane bully.

I'm seeing multiple "strong lane" comments. It will certainly not be in the same table flipping frustration sort of way that he has on live, but we will definitely consider that a strong lane is something Yorick players value.
The heal animations are nice on his current kit.
Great to hear!

I don't know if there's a way to preserve it without making him OP, but one of Yorick's themes for me is...well, Apathy.  (Disclaimer, may not be correct word.)


I'm going to top lane, I don't care about my matchup, I just want to do my dang job, farm some minions, do me some harass. That sort of stuff.



Yorick's not a malevolent dude, he's just doing a job, and I feel that really is important to me. 


He's the guy who's been doing his job for 30000000000000 Years, and at this point just wants to show up, get his pay, and go home.

So, if Taric is not expected until the end of the year (give or take) it's safe to assume we *probably* won't see the Yorick rework before 2016? It's good to know he's not forgotten though, just a bit lower on the priority list. That's ok.

> Are there any things we're missing on what makes Yoirck Yorick?

The sheer soul-crushing siphon of fun and joy of the top lane?  I certainly hope that doesn't stay.

But on a serious note, I'd say "ghoul summoner" and "imposing melee fighter" are pretty much his main traits, maybe tag in "high sustain" if you can do so in a way that isn't as utterly destructive as it is now. 

Thanks for the reply Scruffy.

Yea almost impossible that we could get him out in 2015. Doesn't mean we aren't hard at work on him tho. 

Sustain is something worth considering. I think we have some of that still on the kit but i'll run it by solcrushed too.

Wait, you have the entire Horror/Zombie genre to pick from... and you run with  _"ghoul summoner" and "Imposing melee fighter."_ ?

Oh man... guys, please get a bit more creative than that. Sure, summoning undead can stay par tof his kit but it should not be all that he is about. How about something that he can give fallen minions a proper "burial"? And then they stand up and fight again. A passive like that would make him a respectable lane pusher - and it would tie with his gravedigger thematic ^^

Or some kind of terrain move that lowers the ground in a certain area (think of a weird J4 ult) along with the lines of "this shall be your grave"...

If you want to give him a good rework approach his main theme first and THEN go to the gameplay aspects of the rework. That's how you did it with Sion and it turned out pretty awesome. Doing it the other way around... well, I don't really remember the Karma rework as a sucess, no?

These early pillars are meant to be vague, so that we don't paint ourselves into a corner with a very specific idea that doesn't pan out. 

We will definitely not be satisfied with "generic ghoul guy" and finding the secret sauce on his theme is a big part of what we're exploring right now.

Hey did you ever think about a more "utility" Yorick? i mean, actually he does have a lot of utility (aoe slow, reviving ultimate, self regeneration) but this is not very well exploited. He is a gravedigger, and even more on the shadow isles, he is helping people. He helps people to go from  life.. to another kind of life xD 

Maybe he could remain a lane bully, but he could be relevant lategame with more strategical values that would support his lack of aoe damage by covering his team, and isolate high priority targets once the battle has started. Like : ok early on he is a strong 1v1 character, able to apply a lot of pressure on his lane opponent. But when it comes to midgame and lategame, he would not be only into damage. He is not renekton or riven this is not his identity in my opinion. 

What if his passive could make him interract with dead minions, monsters, or champions, giving them a second, undead, life? i see a "revenge like" use on ally champions, working as the reverse of his actual ultimate wich doesn't make a lot of sense. 
Instead of "okay you're dead, be target that ennemy champion won't focus but will still do more or less the job for a time and die again after" (not really a gravedigger's way to act, and this is i think really frustrating for the ally who will not do much most of the time, and also for the ennemies who never really understand how they have to deal with this) it could be more like "stand up and get a second chance" : when an ally dies, you can choose to bring him back to life for a short duration with bonuses : if he successfully kills an ennemy champion before the end of the effect, he gets back to life for real, and yorick's huge passive's cooldown is reduced. If not, the target's dead time is increased a bit and yorick doesn't get the cd reduction. It would give him a really special power, a really "gravedigger" power : litteraly taking ally champions from their grave, with this extra shadow isle bonus  known as second life.

In lane it would work like his actual ultimate : you killed me ? ok now this is my turn! But when it comes to teamfights, it would be totally different! No more "Yorick ultied him - ok, kill him first, then kite/ignore his clone until it disappears" The bonus granted by the effect would be there to make it a real threat, a real objective to deal with in teamfights. An high risk/high reward move for each team. Yorick would have to chose wisely which ally to traget, when, and his ennemies would have to be aware of his position, and when he does it, to decide what is the priority : focus it first because it's too dangerous, or rush to the ennemy team and try to kite it, taking the risk to fail and let it revive. There couldn't be any situation where they could chose to just ignore him, unless yorick brings back the 0/24 ad {{champion:16}}  from the grave. 
It would also bring a "fun part" to teamfight, where the ennemy would have to prevent Yorick from getting to the tombs, playing hide and seek or just chasing him. Map awareness (wich is important a loooot for a someone supposed to look after a graveyard) could be the funny part of his kit, like having the opportunity to send undead minions/monsters/summons to a place, to cover, attack, distract, while going another to unburrow an ally! 
Yorick would become a living threat if i can say this :3 It could also be another funny starting point to build his kit : after all, summoning characters, no matter what kind of game you plays, are made to cover a very large part of the battle field. If yorick could become a teemo like lane bully (with a lot of single target damage, map awareness and map controle over a resttricted area), it would really fit a him :P

I like his whole "revive someone... but it came back wrong" with his ult.

It would kind of be hilarious to make it so that he can never really die, but instead has a different much weaker kit when dead. Make him literally undead like that, instead of his regular ult.

Leoric the Skeleton King in HotS has a passive kinda like that - when he dies, he turns into a ghost and can still roam around the map. Instead of a death timer, his HP bar refills (over the same amount of time as a death timer, so quickly early game and slower as the game goes on) and when it's full, he revives wherever he's at. The big deal is that he can still cast his abilities while dead, and although they don't do damage or apply CC to enemies, the abilities he has that heal him will still heal him and fill his HP faster (therefore reducing his death time).

^this!!

Instant revive at the fountain, your hp cant drop from 1 for the duration of your *death timer* but you got worse skills
That way you have to be sure you dont take a lot of risk or you'll "revive" beetween 3 enemies at 1 hp.

my two cents on {{champion:83}}  yorick is he is the summoner character of the game. This is a very unique place he holds as league has struggled to make another summoner like character. Sure we have Malz with his passive minions, Azir with his soldiers, Morde with his pets, but Yorick makes it feel like you have a level of control over your minions actions before they cut loose trying to rip your opponents apart. 

So for comparisons sake, the two other big names in MOBA right now, Heroes of the Storm and Dota 2, have their own summoner types. Now Dota 2 is hard to compare to cause every champion is OP in their own way and has a lot of programed in RTS mechanics to manage large amounts of characters.
Heroes is a bit closer though, in Heroes the best comparison i can make is Azmodan. He takes control of a lane by adding more minions to the field, making his opponents have more to deal with, they arent much stronger than a regular lane minion but it adds preasure.

I don't think his skills should change to much in the sense of "these are my minions i must choose who to call" and keeping the utility he gains with them, namely the life steal summon to keep his lane pressure up. As for his ult that is questionable, I kinda think it would be cool to have a "wake the dead" type ult where he summons several minions to swarm his foes.

I am super excited for this rework as i have love yorick for years but have felt for so long he needs worked on. I am a little sad that 3 of my BFs favorite champions are getting their reworks before mine in yorick (his are Sion, Gangplank, and Taric) but i can wait i just pray it can be done before long
It's actually pretty awesome that we have so much room to explore summoner style mechanics because it's not something that we have a lot of in LoL.

ok i mained yorick in season 4 a lot as support.

got me from S5 to S3 (back then with little to no tanks this worked very well). season  5 with the tank meta ... meh not so much there are better champs for that like braum.

so here is why i did it (ofc the meta played a huge role)

from lvl 1-5 there was no way to deal with yorick. get ganked? nope i burst down the jungler making him to scared to come again. blitz/tresh/ naut hooks? well placed W can really cock block that. after you do that 2 - 3 times and save the adc in this manner people are rather glad you went yorick support.

but thats just it. you shine in the early game only to get completely butchered late game (unless you got fed REAL hard)
the feast or famine aspect on yorick is terrible worse then any champion im familiar with.

honestly a necromancer/deathknight ghould summoning shovel knight is awesome just right now the ghouls dont feel right often die to fast. I play malz from time to time and i find his voidlings to be far more reliable for damage output.

personally i would love to see a rework.

sustain -----> IMO <---- shouldn't be there, i know there are archetypes of necromancers out there that have sustain but i would be much more interested in seeing a grey health shield thingy like tahm kench (you know gives counterplay)

ULT the duration feels a tad bit short for what it does and do you know how many allies i have seen run away from the enemy team after they died? yea too many even after you TELL THEM NOT TO im sure this doesn't happen too often in higher ELO but it's still rather frustrating. would it be possible for this ult if it stays to be controlled by the yorick player? and your allies still get assists for champs that get killed by their ghost?

that's all for now i think.
TL;DR
too much feast or famine
too much burden of knowledge at lower elo's
too much sustain early game making him unfun and frustrating to play against.

Oh awesome, thanks for the info. Glad you're passionate about a well rounded yorick. I think "lane bully that falls off hard" is something that we are very careful about making in the future. It's fun to have a good early game, but when it goes too far (like garen/darius) it can be really frustrating to have such little contribution in the late game.

Yeah I love Yorick but many of my friends consider him a "win lane, lose game" kind of champion. Personally I like the feeling of sufficiency that I feel when playing Yorick. I don't need anything or anyone, I don't care for ganks, friend or foe, as long as I keep my vision up and some mana to burn I can rely on my ghouls for everything, which is pretty thematic for a dude that has been living in an working on a cemetery for possibly decades now. It's me and my job, man, and everyone else is sooner or later to become another body to bury. I am in no hurry.

I personally would like to see a more late-game oriented Yorick which could, if you farm up enough, become a good addition to teamfights instead of just lumbering around trying to get to carries while getting CC'd by everyone and contributing almost nothing. Maybe a stack mechanic on minion kills that will help summon two ghouls each cast or maybe a Black Market Brawler style ghoul upgrading feature. Yorick has always been at his best when he's stacked his Manamune, gotten Iceborn gauntlet and a Spirit Visage and if by that point I can start dueling and actually bring some power to fights, my fantasy would be pretty much fulfilled.

When I see Yorick, I think of him as the opposite of Karthus. While Karthus is the master of death, Yorick is the master of the living dead. I actually have a feeling those two would not like each other very much :P

It's interesting from a thematic sense that Yorick is the only not fully dead character from the shadow isles. Feels like it can be used to differentiate him from the other "ghostly" shadow isles peeps.

#**_And please, for the love of everything holy, pure and awesome, don't pull another Trundle and turn Yorick the Grave Digger into Arthas the Lich King._**


Keep the ghouls, keep the shovel and lantern (or guitar) and make lots of new skins for him because your skins team been actively and blatantly ignoring him over the past four-plus years.  A Shovel Knight skin might be a good start (not that I expect to see it before I'm 40 (Feb. 2017)
Being able to turn a 1v1 into a 2v1.
Would he beomce a juggernaut?

"grave digger" maybe he could harvest the souls/bodies of dead minions to gain casts each minion related to a different ghoul,less spamming and more ghoul value/ghoul management i mean you only get cannons every now and then,Supers could buff next ghoul cast.

Please take a look at this I've worked on for a while. My attempt at redefining Yorick.
(A reminder, do not judge based on numbers, clearly they are no where near balanced but please consider the aim at functionality instead)

The new Yorick goes in a different direction than the current selfish solo lane bully he is. This kit still has lane bully potential but has higher reward when coordinating as a team.

Passive - Unearth the Party: every 10 sec (reduced by cdr) Yorick unearths a random Ghoul (red, yellow, blue) that hangs around him until he has all 3 (one of each). They empower Yorick's Q and E depending which Ghoul is next in line.

Yorick also gains 10% more health from items, and takes 5% reduced damage for each Ghoul he has attacking or latched to an enemy (not while waiting for Q or E use) [max 15%]

Red Ghoul: big rampager, big hits and always attacks target Yorick uses basic attacks against.
Yellow Ghoul: short and fat, slow hits, randomly attacks with ranged (400 range) basic attacks.
Blue Ghoul: medium skinny, fast moving and fast attacking, attacks closest enemy.

[Ghouls can take 4 basic attacks to be killed (like wards)]

Notes on Passive: the idea here is Yorick effectively has an additional resource: his ghouls. I wanted him to have an Olimar-like feel. Also, ghouls have more personality and clear distinction aside from color.

Q - Unholy Covenant: (check each skill) fuses energy with one of his ghouls to perform an attack based on the Ghoul. When the ability finishes, that Ghoul begins to attack a nearby enemy for 8 sec before dying.

	* Red: (on-click non-targeting cast) gain massive movement speed for 2 sec and cause the next basic attack to deal % of enemy's max health.
	* Yellow: (on-click non-targeting cast) shield Yorick for up to 250 (+10% Yorick max health) health for 3 sec. When it ends, shield all nearby allies within range for half this value for 1.5 sec.
	* Blue: (fixed directional skillshot, 700 range) send Ghoul out towards location. At max range (1 sec to travel) it'll pull Yorick towards it, dealing up to 250 damage and knocking all enemies in the path up for 1 sec.

50/55/60/65/70 mana, 8/7/6/5/4 cooldown.

Notes on Q: the strength is the skill has 3 strong options, the downside is not having too much control (could bunt one away with E to line up the one you want)

W - Corpse Bomb: (ground-targetting aoe, 850 range) After a brief delay, rupture a green Ghoul from the ground that deals up to 260 magic damage and slows all enemies by up to 60% that decays over 2 sec.

The ghoul remains half in ground, attacking enemies within range, lasts 8 sec.
80 mana, 8 sec cooldown.

Notes on W: potentially has more damage than old W, gives opponent much better time countering the spell. To counter the enemy's counter, Bash the Ghoul towards them! Profit!) Combos fairly well with blue Ghoul Q when timed correctly for nice surprise burst.

E - Cryptic Bash: (direction cast / click-hit directional if targeting green ghoul) Hits one of your ghouls with shovel towards a location, dealing up to 200 magic damage to first enemy hit and latches on for 8 sec, causing basic attacks from allies to trigger bonus effects.

Can hit corpse bomb Ghoul (green) to trigger bonus effect.

	* Red: after 4 basic attacks the Ghoul leaps off and becomes enraged for 4 sec, dealing % of Yorick's health as bonus damage with each attack against the nearest enemy (or whoever Yorick is attacking).
	* Yellow: after 4 basic attacks the Ghoul pops, stunning all enemies around the target for 1.25 sec.
	* Blue: after 4 basic attacks the Ghoul bursts into 8 little ghouls that seek out enemies, blowing up for up to 200 magic damage (10% damage after damaged by one)
	* Green: after 4 basic attacks the Ghoul explodes dealing up to 260 magic damage and slowing all enemies hit by 60% that decays over 2 sec.

40/45/50/55/60 mana, 6 sec cooldown.

Gives Yorick a "batter up!" feel and helps cycle through ghouls to get to the next one for Q. Still gives him range but added incentive to be more of a team fighter rather than a selfish solo by introducing  the 4 attack triggers mechanic.

R - Ghoulpocalypse:
Passive: whenever Yorick dies, after 6 seconds he comes back (ruptures from the ground) as a massive reanimated version for 10 sec with 40/50/60% of his health. [Only access to Q and each use provides all three functions at once but no ghoul is needed nor created. The spell costs no mana during this state]

Active: Yorick buries a near-death (25/35/45% health) ally (cannot use on self) for 2.5 sec, making them immune to all damage but cannot move or perform any action. Once ended, the ally ruptures from the earth with a shield equal to 50% of Yorick's total health for 5 sec.

This unearthing also spawns 3/6/9 random ghouls that begin to attack nearby enemies for 8 sec.
100 mana, 140/120/100 sec cooldown.

Fantasy behind the new ultimate: still preserve that "protect a teammate" while still feeling powerful if Yorick dies in combat.

Each of the ghouls spawned this way function like unearthed ghouls and are randomized (you could theoretically have up to 9 spawned red ghouls) and causes mass hysteria in team fights, but can only be triggered by saving an ally (can't just initiate a fight with it)

Additional notes on ult passive: unsure how "free skills" will work without ghouls, would like feedback to explore what the skills could do or just default to Red Ghoul skills
Mana Sustain. He needs some of that If these high mana costs are going to stay.

Right now, his ult is the only thing about him that's the least bit fun.  He's possibly the most boring champion in the league, almost tied with Taric.

I think he might need some sort of alternate death-based resource, but this can be tricky because he shouldn't be useless outside of lane.  So I understand that it's a tall order.  But please, anything but spamming three spells that incidentally summon a minion that only lasts 2-3 seconds.  If anything, he should have one summon skill and two interactive skills, sort of like Azir.  In fact, Azir feels a little like a promising Yorick rework that eventually evolved until it turned into its own thing...

There are two important aspects of Yorick to me:
1. He summons ghouls.
2. He hits people with a shovel

Nail those two things and it will be Yorick to me. I would love to see some gameplay that interacts more with how he's a gravedigger. Like some kind of digging mechanic. Maybe he could literally dig a grave for his enemies that they have to escape from?

ghoul spam, and ghoul commander; even if the ghoul spam is restricted for more late game via spell cooldowns that get super tiny by ranks 4 and 5 and make his early game less dominating and allow him to scale really well--- also making someone a zombie is cool and unique, the problem to it is that it doesn't feel very good for the yorick player

Obligatory "Who's Yorick?" post. 

Seriously though, I want an answer as well. I don't even play current Yorick; it's just silly to have his rework delayed for literally years.
You will remember Yorick Mori.

His Ult should change. Another Rioter said his ult had something that they promised never to do again which was have a two ult in one deal. I don't want his ult to stay the same since it seems weak but something along those lines. Going for broke but maybe ulting a dead allies body instantly respawns them. Either at location or makes the Death Timer go to Zero. And/or making them undying for a few seconds if cast while alive.

The rework is probably dead, and he is in grave danger of being forgotten. He's just a ghost of his former self, and they need to revive him with a rework as soon as possible.

And other puns. They're really easy to shovel out.

I actually stopped playing some time back from a lack of notice of Yorick at all.  I don't mention it much anymore, but I had my suggestions listed in a thread providing several options that kept his theme added some utility and sacrificed some lane presence.
